comment.author: 22968943@N05
comment._content: The B-25 was called the "Mitchell" not the "Fairfax." North Amerian did have a manufacturing facility at "Fairfax Airport" in Kansas City, Kansas, if Wikipedia is to be believed.  Perhaps that is the source of confusion?  Or did they call it the Fairfax before it was christened the Mitchell?

comment.author: 32821910@N03
comment._content: The B-25 was called the "Mitchell" in honor of Gen. "Billy" Mitchell who was the driving force behind establishing the USAF. One of North American Aviation's manufacturing plants was Fairfax Airport where they were assembling B-25s

comment.author: 16612979@N00
comment._content: Fairfax was the location of one of the B-25 plants
